title: Availability and unavailability management
content: Availability : Definition & utilityAvailability is a way to quickly see if your employee:Can work for the day Can't workIs already busy working at another position or branchThe availability of your employees is not their schedules, but rather the time ranges for which they are available to work.By having configured the availability correctly, you will be able to know in real-time which of your employees are available to work on a week, a day, or a specific time of the day. Emprez will assist you when creating your schedules thanks to several color codes and symbols which you will discover in the section below.Before creating your schedule, it is preferable to modify the availability of your employees according to their particularities.Color codes in practiceThe shifts available for your employee are displayed in greenYour employee non-availability is displayed in yellowRisks of scheduling conflicts are displayed in redHover over  with your mouse to consult the availability or unavailability of your employee   will appear if you are trying to schedule a shift that does not respect your employee's availability.Hover over the icon to see the nature of the problem. Change employee availabilityIf when you schedule employees, you get errors that the employee is not available, there may be a problem with their availability in the system.You have two ways to rectify the situation:1. Edit from the employee fileWeekly availabilityAccess the employee's file concerned,In the Parameters section, click on Work Availability,On the next page, click  to add,Choose the Date Effective of the week for which the employee's availability changes,Put a note (optional),Choose each day of the week, then +Add to add hours,Change the hours of availability, if necessary,Repeat the process for each day of the week,Click Save.2. Ask your employees to submit their weekly availability or occasional unavailability to youYour employee will need to follow this guide to submit their availability or unavailability.Once done, you (the manager) must accept the request for it to be validated. To do this, you must go to the Messages, Once approved, these availabilities or unavailability will go directly into the schedules.Helpful?10Updated: 2 years ago Share :
